question: G is the centroid in the equilateral △ ABC. If AB = 10 cm then length of AG is :
explanation: AB = 10cm BD = 5 cm ∠ADB = 90° ∴ AD = $latex \\sqrt{AB^{2} - BD^{2}}$ $latex => \\sqrt{10^{2}-5^{2}} = \\sqrt{100-25}$ $latex => \\sqrt{75} = 5\\sqrt{3}cm$ $latex AG =$ $latex \\frac{2}{3}&s=1$ $latex AD=$ $latex \\frac{2}{3}\\times 5\\sqrt{3}&s=1$ $latex = \\frac{10\\sqrt{3}}{3}cm&s=1$ Hence option [C] is the right answer.
